releases.details: Special Edition released on Revisitations 3 box set.
special_features: Toby Hadoke's humorous history of robots

notes: The serial was influenced by works such as Isaac Asimov's robot mysteries and Agatha Christie's And Then There Were None.
The setting and concept of sandmining were inspired by Frank Herbert's Dune.
Tom Baker was critical of the script, wanting specific characteristics for the Doctor.

in_universe_mythology: The Doctor uses his respiratory bypass system.
Robophobia, referred to in-universe as Grimwade's Syndrome.
real_world_cultural_references: The Doctor likens a sinking to the Titanic.
Robots inspired by works of Isaac Asimov and Agatha Christie.

continuity_notes: Characters reappear in Chris Boucher's later novels and Kaldor City audio spinoffs.
An attempt to explain how the TARDIS is dimensionally transcendental is provided.

plot.plot_summary: The Doctor and Leela arrive on a sandminer vessel on a distant planet. They stand accused of a series of murders at the hands of the miner's crew, who suspect the robots that serve them. As the Doctor attempts to prove their innocence and uncover the true murderer, it becomes clear a conspiracy involving a human posing as the mysterious figure, Taren Capel, desires to incite a robot rebellion. A showdown of evasive maneuvers and clever strategy ultimately reveals that one of the crew members is the mastermind behind the murders, leading to a resolution where the Doctor and Leela leave the surviving crew awaiting rescue.
